topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack 1.1: Object Storage (Swift) Service Overview

othermeta.name: role
othermeta.content: Ranjan J, Keshava HPE Sameer V, Jayme P, Binamra S

body.p: HPE Helion OpenStack introduces integral, built-in support for Scale-out Object Storage (Swift) to the cloud. The HPE Helion OpenStack cloud deployment includes automatic creation of a Swift cluster and starter nodes. It also enables SSL automatically to secure the data transmission.
Based on OpenStack Swift, the HPE Helion OpenStack object storage service provides a highly available, resilient, and scalable storage pool for unstructured data.

section.title: Architecture Overview
section.p: At its core, Object Storage (Swift) is built from a set of software services and data constructs hosted on a cluster of servers.
A Object Storage (Swift) cluster is Software Defined Storage (SDS) architecture, layered on top of industry standard servers, using native storage devices which are typically disk drives.
section.note: It is not recommended to run Swift on top of other systems (hardware or software) that hide the failure domains or native storage devices like using RAID group on top of drives.
section.p: The services in the Swift cluster are either access services or storage services.

ul.li: The access services group is made up of the Swift Proxy Servers, which run Swift-Proxy, Account and Container Services, HTTP/HTTPS load balancers, and OpenStack Keystone authentication service.
The storage services group is composed of Swift Object Servers and various background services such as replicators.

section.p: Each service group can be scaled independently to meet workload and redundancy requirements. The storage service can be scaled up as necessary (scale-out Swift). It can also be horizontally scalable to handle an increased number of simultaneous connections as well as large number of objects.

section.title: Expanding the Object Storage (Swift) Deployment
section.p: Note that the initial installation of HPE Helion OpenStack cloud includes the creation and configuration of a basic two-node Starter All-in-one Swift deployment. Any additional rings, nodes or servers are expansions of this basic installation.
For more information and in-depth diagrams, see About Scale-Out Object Storage (Swift).
